properties.name: active
properties.description: • active - (Optional) Whether or not the check is enabled or not (default true).

properties.name: caql
properties.description: • caql - (Optional) A Circonus Analytics Query Language (CAQL) check. See below for details on how to configure a caql check.

properties.name: cloudwatch
properties.description: • cloudwatch - (Optional) A CloudWatch check check. See below for details on how to configure a cloudwatch check.

properties.name: collector
properties.description: • collector - (Required) A collector ID. The collector(s) that are responsible for running a circonus_check. The id can be the Circonus ID for a Circonus collector (a.k.a. "broker") running in the cloud or an enterprise collector running in your datacenter. One collection of metrics will be automatically created for each collector specified.

properties.name: consul
properties.description: • consul - (Optional) A native Consul check. See below for details on how to configure a consul check.

properties.name: http
properties.description: • http - (Optional) A poll-based HTTP check. See below for details on how to configure the http check.

properties.name: httptrap
properties.description: • httptrap - (Optional) An push-based HTTP check. This check method expects clients to send a specially crafted HTTP JSON payload. See below for details on how to configure the httptrap check.

properties.name: icmp_ping
properties.description: • icmp_ping - (Optional) An ICMP ping check. See below for details on how to configure the icmp_ping check.

properties.name: json
properties.description: • json - (Optional) A JSON check. See below for details on how to configure the json check.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Required) A list of one or more metric configurations. All metrics obtained from this check instance will be available as individual metric streams. See below for a list of supported metric attrbutes.

properties.name: metric_limit
properties.description: • metric_limit - (Optional) Setting a metric limit will tell the Circonus backend to periodically look at the check to see if there are additional metrics the collector has seen that we should collect. It will not reactivate metrics previously collected and then marked as inactive. Values are 0 to disable, -1 to enable all metrics or N+ to collect up to the value N (both -1 and N+ can not exceed other account restrictions).

properties.name: mysql
properties.description: • mysql - (Optional) A MySQL check. See below for details on how to configure the mysql check.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The name of the check that will be displayed in the web interface.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Notes about this check.

properties.name: period
properties.description: • period - (Optional) The period between each time the check is made in seconds.

properties.name: postgresql
properties.description: • postgresql - (Optional) A PostgreSQL check. See below for details on how to configure the postgresql check.

properties.name: statsd
properties.description: • statsd - (Optional) A statsd check. See below for details on how to configure the statsd check.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags assigned to this check.

properties.name: target
properties.description: • target - (Required) A string containing the location of the thing being checked. This value changes based on the check type. For example, for an http check type this would be the URL you're checking. For a DNS check it would be the hostname you wanted to look up.

properties.name: tcp
properties.description: • tcp - (Optional) A TCP check. See below for details on how to configure the tcp check (includes TLS support).

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) A floating point number representing the maximum number of seconds this check should wait for a result. Defaults to 10.0.

properties.name: supported-metric-attributes
properties.description: » Supported metric Attributes
The following attributes are available within a metric.

properties.name: active
properties.description: (Optional) Whether or not the metric is active or not. Defaults to true.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the metric. A string containing freeform text.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tags assigned to the metric.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) A string containing either numeric, text, histogram, composite, or caql.

properties.name: units
properties.description: (Optional) The unit of measurement the metric represents (e.g., bytes, seconds, milliseconds). A string containing freeform text.

properties.name: supported-check-types
properties.description: » Supported Check Types

Circonus supports a variety of different checks. Each check type has its own set of options that must be configured. Each check type conflicts with every other check type (i.e. a circonus_check configured for a json check will conflict with all other check types, therefore a postgresql check must be a different circonus_check resource).

properties.name: caql-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » caql Check Type Attributes

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Required) The CAQL Query to run.
Available metrics depend on the payload returned in the caql check. See the caql check type for additional details.

properties.name: cloudwatch-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » cloudwatch Check Type Attributes

properties.name: api_key
properties.description: • api_key - (Required) The AWS access key. If this value is not explicitly set, this value is populated by the environment variable AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.

properties.name: api_secret
properties.description: • api_secret - (Required) The AWS secret key. If this value is not explicitly set, this value is populated by the environment variable AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.

properties.name: dimmensions
properties.description: • dimmensions - (Required) A map of the CloudWatch dimmensions to include in the check.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Required) A list of metric names to collect in this check.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: • namespace - (Required) The namespace to pull parameters from.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The AWS URL to pull from. This should be set to the region-specific endpoint (e.g. prefer https://monitoring.us-east-1.amazonaws.com over https://monitoring.amazonaws.com).

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) The version of the Cloudwatch API to use. Defaults to 2010-08-01.

Available metrics depend on the payload returned in the cloudwatch check. See the cloudwatch check type for additional details. The circonus_check period attribute must be set to either 60s or 300s for CloudWatch metrics.
Example CloudWatch check (partial metrics collection):

variable "cloudwatch_rds_tags" {
  type = "list"
  default = [
    "app:postgresql",
    "app:rds",
    "source:cloudwatch",
  ]
}

resource "circonus_check" "rds_metrics" {
  active = true
  name = "Terraform test: RDS Metrics via CloudWatch"
  notes = "Collect RDS metrics"
  period = "60s"

  collector {
    id = "/broker/1"
  }

  cloudwatch {
    dimmensions = {
      DBInstanceIdentifier = "my-db-name",
    }

    metric = [
      "CPUUtilization",
      "DatabaseConnections",
    ]

    namespace = "AWS/RDS"
    url = "https://monitoring.us-east-1.amazonaws.com"
  }

  metric {
    name = "CPUUtilization"
    tags = [ "${var.cloudwatch_rds_tags}" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "%"
  }

  metric {
    name = "DatabaseConnections"
    tags = [ "${var.cloudwatch_rds_tags}" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "connections"
  }
}

properties.name: consul-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » consul Check Type Attributes

properties.name: acl_token
properties.description: • acl_token - (Optional) An ACL Token authenticate the API request. When an ACL Token is set, this value is transmitted as an HTTP Header in order to not show up in any logs. The default value is an empty string.

properties.name: allow_stale
properties.description: • allow_stale - (Optional) A boolean value that indicates whether or not this check should require the health information come from the Consul leader node. For scalability reasons, this value defaults to false. See below for details on detecting the staleness of health information.

properties.name: ca_chain
properties.description: • ca_chain - (Optional) A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (required when http_addr is a TLS-enabled endpoint).

properties.name: certificate_file
properties.description: • certificate_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (required when http_addr is a TLS-enabled endpoint).

properties.name: check_blacklist
properties.description: • check_blacklist - (Optional) A list of check names to exclude from the result of checks (i.e. no metrics will be generated by whose check name is in the check_blacklist). This blacklist is applied to the node, service, and state check modes.

properties.name: ciphers
properties.description: • ciphers - (Optional) A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (only used when http_addr is a TLS-enabled endpoint).

properties.name: dc
properties.description: • dc - (Optional) Explicitly name the Consul datacenter to use. The default value is an empty string. When an empty value is specified, the Consul datacenter of the agent at the http_addr is implicitly used.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: • headers - (Optional) A map of the HTTP headers to be sent when executing the check. NOTE: the headers attribute is processed last and will takes precidence over any other derived value that is transmitted as an HTTP header to Consul (i.e. it is possible to override the acl_token by setting a headers value).

properties.name: http_addr
properties.description: • http_addr - (Optional) The Consul HTTP endpoint to to query for health information. The default value is http://consul.service.consul:8500. The scheme must change from http to https when the endpoint has been TLS-enabled.

properties.name: key_file
properties.description: • key_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (required when http_addr is a TLS-enabled endpoint).

properties.name: node
properties.description: • node - (Optional) Check the health of this node. The value can be either a Consul Node ID (Consul Version >= 0.7.4) or Node Name. See also the service_blacklist, node_blacklist, and check_blacklist attributes. This attribute conflicts with the service and state attributes.

properties.name: node_blacklist
properties.description: • node_blacklist - (Optional) A list of node IDs or node names to exclude from the results of checks (i.e. no metrics will be generated from nodes in the node_blacklist). This blacklist is applied to the node, service, and state check modes.

properties.name: service
properties.description: • service - (Optional) Check the cluster-wide health of this named service. See also the service_blacklist, node_blacklist, and check_blacklist attributes. This attribute conflicts with the node and state attributes.

properties.name: service_blacklist
properties.description: • service_blacklist - (Optional) A list of service names to exclude from the result of checks (i.e. no metrics will be generated by services whose service name is in the service_blacklist). This blacklist is applied to the node, service, and state check modes.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - (Optional) A Circonus check to monitor Consul checks across the entire Consul cluster. This value may be either passing, warning, or critical. This consul check mode is intended to act as the cluster check of last resort. This check type is useful when first starting and is intended to act as a check of last resort before transitioning to explicitly defined checks for individual services or nodes. The metrics returned from check will be sorted based on the CreateIndex of the entry in order to have a stable set of metrics in the array of returned values. See also the service_blacklist, node_blacklist, and check_blacklist attributes. This attribute conflicts with the node and state attributes.

Available metrics depend on the consul check being performed (node, service, or state). In addition to the data avilable from the endpoints, the consul check also returns a set of metrics that are a variant of: {Num,Pct}{,Passing,Warning,Critical}{Checks,Nodes,Services} (see the GLOB_BRACE section of your local glob(3) documentation).
Example Consul check (partial metrics collection):

resource "circonus_check" "consul_server" {
  active = true
  name = "%s"
  period = "60s"

  collector {
    # Collector ID must be an Enterprise broker able to reach the Consul agent
    # listed in `http_addr`.
    id = "/broker/2110"
  }

  consul {
    service = "consul"

    # Other consul check modes:
    # node = "consul1"
    # state = "critical"
  }

  metric {
    name = "NumNodes"
    tags = [ "source:consul", "lifecycle:unittest" ]
    type = "numeric"
  }

  metric {
    name = "LastContact"
    tags = [ "source:consul", "lifecycle:unittest" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "seconds"
  }

  metric {
    name = "Index"
    tags = [ "source:consul", "lifecycle:unittest" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "transactions"
  }

  metric {
    name = "KnownLeader"
    tags = [ "source:consul", "lifecycle:unittest" ]
    type = "text"
  }

  tags = [ "source:consul", "lifecycle:unittest" ]
}

properties.name: http-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » http Check Type Attributes

properties.name: auth_method
properties.description: • auth_method - (Optional) HTTP Authentication method to use. When set must be one of the values Basic, Digest, or Auto.

properties.name: auth_password
properties.description: • auth_password - (Optional) The password to use during authentication.

properties.name: auth_user
properties.description: • auth_user - (Optional) The user to authenticate as.

properties.name: body_regexp
properties.description: • body_regexp - (Optional) This regular expression is matched against the body of the response. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as "bad."

properties.name: ca_chain
properties.description: • ca_chain - (Optional) A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: certificate_file
properties.description: • certificate_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS checks).

properties.name: ciphers
properties.description: • ciphers - (Optional) A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks).

properties.name: code
properties.description: • code - (Optional) The HTTP code that is expected. If the code received does not match this regular expression, the check is marked as "bad."

properties.name: extract
properties.description: • extract - (Optional) This regular expression is matched against the body of the response globally. The first capturing match is the key and the second capturing match is the value. Each key/value extracted is registered as a metric for the check.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: • headers - (Optional) A map of the HTTP headers to be sent when executing the check.

properties.name: key_file
properties.description: • key_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Optional) The HTTP Method to use. Defaults to GET.

properties.name: payload
properties.description: • payload - (Optional) The information transferred as the payload of an HTTP request.

properties.name: read_limit
properties.description: • read_limit - (Optional) Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit). Default 0.

properties.name: redirects
properties.description: • redirects - (Optional) The maximum number of HTTP Location header redirects to follow. Default 0.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The target for this json check. The url must include the scheme, host, port (optional), and path to use (e.g. https://app1.example.org/healthz)

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) The HTTP version to use. Defaults to 1.1.

Available metrics include: body_match, bytes, cert_end, cert_end_in, cert_error, cert_issuer, cert_start, cert_subject, code, duration, truncated, tt_connect, and tt_firstbyte. See the http check type for additional details.

properties.name: httptrap-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » httptrap Check Type Attributes

properties.name: async_metrics
properties.description: • async_metrics - (Optional) Boolean value specifies whether or not httptrap metrics are logged immediately or held until the status message is to be emitted. Default false.

properties.name: secret
properties.description: • secret - (Optional) Specify the secret with which metrics may be submitted.
Available metrics depend on the payload returned in the httptrap doc. See the httptrap check type for additional details.

properties.name: json-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » json Check Type Attributes

properties.name: auth_method
properties.description: • auth_method - (Optional) HTTP Authentication method to use. When set must be one of the values Basic, Digest, or Auto.

properties.name: auth_password
properties.description: • auth_password - (Optional) The password to use during authentication.

properties.name: auth_user
properties.description: • auth_user - (Optional) The user to authenticate as.

properties.name: ca_chain
properties.description: • ca_chain - (Optional) A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: certificate_file
properties.description: • certificate_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS checks).

properties.name: ciphers
properties.description: • ciphers - (Optional) A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks).

properties.name: headers
properties.description: • headers - (Optional) A map of the HTTP headers to be sent when executing the check.

properties.name: key_file
properties.description: • key_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Optional) The HTTP Method to use. Defaults to GET.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) The TCP Port number to use. Defaults to 81.

properties.name: read_limit
properties.description: • read_limit - (Optional) Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit). Default 0.

properties.name: redirects
properties.description: • redirects - (Optional) The maximum number of HTTP Location header redirects to follow. Default 0.

properties.name: url
properties.description: • url - (Required) The target for this json check. The url must include the scheme, host, port (optional), and path to use (e.g. https://app1.example.org/healthz)

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) The HTTP version to use. Defaults to 1.1.
Available metrics depend on the payload returned in the json doc. See the json check type for additional details.

properties.name: icmp_ping-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » icmp_ping Check Type Attributes
The icmp_ping check requires the target top-level attribute to be set.

properties.name: availability
properties.description: (Optional) The percentage of ping packets that must be returned for this measurement to be considered successful. Defaults to 100.0.

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Optional) The number of ICMP ping packets to send. Defaults to 5.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional) Interval between packets. Defaults to 2s.
Available metrics include: available, average, count, maximum, and minimum. See the ping_icmp check type for additional details.

properties.name: mysql-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » mysql Check Type Attributes
The mysql check requires the target top-level attribute to be set.

properties.name: dsn
properties.description: (Required) The MySQL DSN/connect string to use to talk to MySQL.

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Required) The SQL query to execute.

properties.name: postgresql-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » postgresql Check Type Attributes
The postgresql check requires the target top-level attribute to be set.

properties.name: dsn
properties.description: (Required) The PostgreSQL DSN/connect string to use to talk to PostgreSQL.

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Required) The SQL query to execute.
Available metric names are dependent on the output of the query being run.

properties.name: statsd-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » statsd Check Type Attributes

properties.name: source_ip
properties.description: (Required) Any statsd messages from this IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) will be associated with this check.
Available metrics depend on the metrics sent to the statsd check.

properties.name: tcp-check-type-attributes
properties.description: » tcp Check Type Attributes

properties.name: banner_regexp
properties.description: • banner_regexp - (Optional) This regular expression is matched against the response banner. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as bad.

properties.name: ca_chain
properties.description: • ca_chain - (Optional) A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: certificate_file
properties.description: • certificate_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS checks).

properties.name: ciphers
properties.description: • ciphers - (Optional) A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks).

properties.name: host
properties.description: • host - (Required) Hostname or IP address of the host to connect to.

properties.name: key_file
properties.description: • key_file - (Optional) A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks).

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) Integer specifying the port on which the management interface can be reached.

properties.name: tls
properties.description: • tls - (Optional) When enabled establish a TLS connection.

Available metrics include: banner, banner_match, cert_end, cert_end_in, cert_error, cert_issuer, cert_start, cert_subject, duration, tt_connect, tt_firstbyte. See the tcp check type for additional details.
Sample tcp check:

resource "circonus_check" "tcp_check" {
  name = "TCP and TLS check"
  notes = "Obtains the connect time and TTL for the TLS cert"
  period = "60s"

  collector {
    id = "/broker/1"
  }

  tcp {
    host = "127.0.0.1"
    port = 443
    tls = true
  }

  metric {
    name = "cert_end_in"
    tags = [ "${var.tcp_check_tags}" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "seconds"
  }

  metric {
    name = "tt_connect"
    tags = [ "${var.tcp_check_tags}" ]
    type = "numeric"
    unit = "miliseconds"
  }

  tags = [ "${var.tcp_check_tags}" ]
}

properties.name: out-parameters
properties.description: » Out Parameters

properties.name: check_by_collector
properties.description: • check_by_collector - Maps the ID of the collector (collector_id, the map key) to the check_id (value) that is registered to a collector.

properties.name: check_id
properties.description: • check_id - If there is only one collector specified for the check, this value will be populated with the check_id. If more than one collector is specified in the check, then this value will be an empty string. check_by_collector will always be populated.

properties.name: checks
properties.description: • checks - List of check_ids created by this circonus_check. There is one element in this list per collector specified in the check.

properties.name: created
properties.description: • created - UNIX time at which this check was created.

properties.name: last_modified
properties.description: • last_modified - UNIX time at which this check was last modified.

properties.name: last_modified_by
properties.description: • last_modified_by - User ID in Circonus who modified this check last.

properties.name: reverse_connect_urls
properties.description: • reverse_connect_urls - Only relevant to Circonus support.

properties.name: uuids
properties.description: • uuids - List of Check uuids created by this circonus_check. There is one element in this list per collector specified in the check.

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_check supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform (and that the referenced circonus_metric has already been imported):

provider "circonus" {
  alias = "b8fec159-f9e5-4fe6-ad2c-dc1ec6751586"
}

resource "circonus_metric" "used" {
  name = "_usage`0`_used"
  type = "numeric"
}

resource "circonus_check" "usage" {
  collector {
    id = "/broker/1"
  }

  json {
    url = "https://api.circonus.com/account/current"

    headers = {
      "Accept"                = "application/json"
      "X-Circonus-App-Name"   = "TerraformCheck"
      "X-Circonus-Auth-Token" = "${var.api_token}"
    }
  }

  metric {
    name = "${circonus_metric.used.name}"
    type = "${circonus_metric.used.type}"
  }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_check resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_check.usage ID
Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the Check Bundle (e.g. /check_bundle/12345) and circonus_check.usage is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: aggregation_window
properties.description: • aggregation_window - (Optional) The aggregation window for batching up alert notifications.

properties.name: alert_option
properties.description: • alert_option - (Optional) There is one alert_option per severity, where severity can be any number between 1 (high) and 5 (low). If configured, the alerting system will remind or escalate alerts to further contact groups if an alert sent to this contact group is not acknowledged or resolved. See below for details.

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email - (Optional) Zero or more email attributes may be present to dispatch email to Circonus users by referencing their user ID, or by specifying an email address. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: http
properties.description: • http - (Optional) Zero or more http attributes may be present to dispatch Webhook/HTTP requests by Circonus. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: irc
properties.description: • irc - (Optional) Zero or more irc attributes may be present to dispatch IRC notifications to users. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: long_message
properties.description: • long_message - (Optional) The bulk of the message used in long form alert messages.

properties.name: long_subject
properties.description: • long_subject - (Optional) The subject used in long form alert messages.

properties.name: long_summary
properties.description: • long_summary - (Optional) The brief summary used in long form alert messages.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the contact group.

properties.name: pager_duty
properties.description: • pager_duty - (Optional) Zero or more pager_duty attributes may be present to dispatch to Pager Duty teams. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: short_message
properties.description: • short_message - (Optional) The subject used in short form alert messages.

properties.name: short_summary
properties.description: • short_summary - (Optional) The brief summary used in short form alert messages.

properties.name: slack
properties.description: • slack - (Optional) Zero or more slack attributes may be present to dispatch to Slack teams. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: sms
properties.description: • sms - (Optional) Zero or more sms attributes may be present to dispatch SMS messages to Circonus users by referencing their user ID, or by specifying an SMS Phone Number. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags attached to the Contact Group.

properties.name: victorops
properties.description: • victorops - (Optional) Zero or more victorops attributes may be present to dispatch to VictorOps teams. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: supported-contact-group-alert_option-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group alert_option Attributes

properties.name: escalate_after
properties.description: • escalate_after - (Optional) How long to wait before escalating an alert that is received at a given severity.

properties.name: escalate_to
properties.description: • escalate_to - (Optional) The Contact Group ID who will receive the escalation.

properties.name: reminder
properties.description: • reminder - (Optional) If specified, reminders will be sent after a user configurable number of minutes for open alerts.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: • severity - (Required) An alert_option must be assigned to a given severity level. Valid severity levels range from 1 (highest severity) to 5 (lowest severity).

properties.name: supported-contact-group-email-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group email Attributes
Either an address or user attribute is required.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) A well formed email address.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) An email will be sent to the email address of record for the corresponding user ID (e.g. /user/1234).

A user's email address is automatically maintained and kept up to date by the recipient, whereas an address provides no automatic layer of indirection for keeping the information accurate (including LDAP and SAML-based authentication mechanisms).

properties.name: supported-contact-group-http-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group http Attributes

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Required) URL to send a webhook request to.

properties.name: format
properties.description: • format - (Optional) The payload of the request is a JSON-encoded payload when the format is set to json (the default). The alternate payload encoding is params.

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Optional) The HTTP verb to use when making a request. Either GET or POST may be specified. The default verb is POST.

properties.name: supported-contact-group-irc-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group irc Attributes

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Required) When a user has configured IRC on their user account, they will receive an IRC notification.

properties.name: supported-contact-group-pager_duty-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group pager_duty Attributes

properties.name: contact_group_fallback
properties.description: • contact_group_fallback - (Optional) If there is a problem contacting PagerDuty, relay the notification automatically to the specified Contact Group (e.g. /contact_group/1234).

properties.name: service_key
properties.description: • service_key - (Required) The PagerDuty Service Key.

properties.name: webhook_url
properties.description: • webhook_url - (Required) The PagerDuty webhook URL that PagerDuty uses to notify Circonus of acknowledged actions.

properties.name: supported-contact-group-slack-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group slack Attributes

properties.name: contact_group_fallback
properties.description: • contact_group_fallback - (Optional) If there is a problem contacting Slack, relay the notification automatically to the specified Contact Group (e.g. /contact_group/1234).

properties.name: buttons
properties.description: • buttons - (Optional) Slack notifications can have acknowledgement buttons built into the notification message itself when enabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: channel
properties.description: • channel - (Required) Specify what Slack channel Circonus should send alerts to.

properties.name: team
properties.description: • team - (Required) Specify what Slack team Circonus should look in for the aforementioned channel.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Optional) Specify the username Circonus should advertise itself as in Slack. Defaults to Circonus.

properties.name: supported-contact-group-sms-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group sms Attributes
Either an address or user attribute is required.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) SMS Phone Number to send a short notification to.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) An SMS page will be sent to the phone number of record for the corresponding user ID (e.g. /user/1234).

A user's phone number is automatically maintained and kept up to date by the recipient, whereas an address provides no automatic layer of indirection for keeping the information accurate (including LDAP and SAML-based authentication mechanisms).

properties.name: supported-contact-group-victorops-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group victorops Attributes

properties.name: contact_group_fallback
properties.description: • contact_group_fallback - (Optional) If there is a problem contacting VictorOps, relay the notification automatically to the specified Contact Group (e.g. /contact_group/1234).

properties.name: api_key
properties.description: • api_key - (Required) The API Key for talking with VictorOps.

properties.name: critical
properties.description: • critical - (Required)

properties.name: info
properties.description: • info - (Required)

properties.name: team
properties.description: • team - (Required)

properties.name: warning
properties.description: • warning - (Required)

properties.name: supported-contact-group-xmpp-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Contact Group xmpp Attributes
Either an address or user attribute is required.

properties.name: address
properties.description: • address - (Optional) XMPP address to send a short notification to.

properties.name: user
properties.description: • user - (Optional) An XMPP notification will be sent to the XMPP address of record for the corresponding user ID (e.g. /user/1234).

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_contact_group supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform:

provider "circonus" {
  alias = "b8fec159-f9e5-4fe6-ad2c-dc1ec6751586"
}

resource "circonus_contact_group" "myteam" {
  name = "My Team's Contact Group"

  email {
    address = "myteam@example.com"
  }

  slack {
    channel = "#myteam"
    team = "T024UT03C"
  }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_contact_group resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_contact_group.myteam ID

Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the Contact Group (e.g. /contact_group/12345) and circonus_contact_group.myteam is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of what the graph is for.

properties.name: graph_style
properties.description: • graph_style - (Optional) How the graph should be rendered. Valid options are area or line (default).

properties.name: left
properties.description: • left - (Optional) A map of graph left axis options. Valid values in left include: logarithmic can be set to 0 (default) or 1; min is the min Y axis value on the left; and max is the Y axis max value on the left.

properties.name: line_style
properties.description: • line_style - (Optional) How the line should change between points. Can be either stepped (default) or interpolated.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The title of the graph.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) A place for storing notes about this graph.

properties.name: right
properties.description: • right - (Optional) A map of graph right axis options. Valid values in right include: logarithmic can be set to 0 (default) or 1; min is the min Y axis value on the right; and max is the Y axis max value on the right.

properties.name: metric
properties.description: • metric - (Optional) A list of metric streams to graph. See below for options.

properties.name: metric_cluster
properties.description: • metric_cluster - (Optional) A metric cluster to graph. See below for options.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags assigned to this graph.

properties.name: metric-configuration
properties.description: » metric Configuration

An individual metric stream is the underlying source of data points used for visualization in a graph. Either a caql attribute is required or a check and metric must be set. The metric attribute can have the following options set.

properties.name: active
properties.description: • active - (Optional) A boolean if the metric stream is enabled or not.

properties.name: alpha
properties.description: • alpha - (Optional) A floating point number between 0 and 1.

properties.name: axis
properties.description: • axis - (Optional) The axis that the metric stream will use. Valid options are left (default) or right.

properties.name: caql
properties.description: • caql - (Optional) A CAQL formula. Conflicts with the check and metric attributes.

properties.name: check
properties.description: • check - (Optional) The check that this metric stream belongs to.

properties.name: color
properties.description: • color - (Optional) A hex-encoded color of the line / area on the graph.

properties.name: formula
properties.description: • formula - (Optional) Formula that should be aplied to both the values in the graph and the legend.

properties.name: legend_formula
properties.description: • legend_formula - (Optional) Formula that should be applied to values in the legend.

properties.name: function
properties.description: • function - (Optional) What derivative value, if any, should be used. Valid values are: gauge (default), derive, and counter (_stddev)

properties.name: metric_type
properties.description: • metric_type - (Required) The type of the metric. Valid values are: numeric, text, histogram, composite, or caql.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name which will appear in the graph legend.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: • metric_name - (Optional) The name of the metric stream within the check to graph.

properties.name: stack
properties.description: • stack - (Optional) If this metric is to be stacked, which stack set does it belong to (starting at 0).

properties.name: metric_cluster-configuration
properties.description: » metric_cluster Configuration
A metric cluster selects multiple metric streams together dynamically using a query language and returns the set of matching metric streams as a single result set to the graph rendering engine.

properties.name: active
properties.description: • active - (Optional) A boolean if the metric cluster is enabled or not.

properties.name: aggregate
properties.description: • aggregate - (Optional) The aggregate function to apply across this metric cluster to create a single value. Valid values are: none (default), min, max, sum, mean, or geometric_mean.

properties.name: axis
properties.description: • axis - (Optional) The axis that the metric cluster will use. Valid options are left (default) or right.

properties.name: color
properties.description: • color - (Optional) A hex-encoded color of the line / area on the graph. This is a required attribute when aggregate is specified.

properties.name: group
properties.description: • group - (Optional) The metric_cluster that will provide datapoints for this graph.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) A name which will appear in the graph legend for this metric cluster.

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_graph supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform (and that the referenced circonus_metric and circonus_check have already been imported):

resource "circonus_graph" "icmp-graph" {
  name        = "Test graph"
  graph_style = "line"
  line_style  = "stepped"

  metric {
    check       = "${circonus_check.api_latency.checks[0]}"
    metric_name = "maximum"
    metric_type = "numeric"
    name        = "Maximum Latency"
    axis        = "left"
  }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_graph resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_graph.icmp-graph ID

Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the graph (e.g. /graph/bd72aabc-90b9-4039-cc30-c9ab838c18f5) and circonus_graph.icmp-graph is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: active
properties.description: • active - (Optional) A boolean indicating if the metric is being filtered out at the circonus_check's collector(s) or not.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the metric. A name must be unique within a circonus_check and its meaning is circonus_check.type specific.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags assigned to the metric.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of metric. This value must be present and can be one of the following values: numeric, text, histogram, composite, or caql.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: • unit - (Optional) The unit of measurement for this circonus_metric.

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_metric supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform:

provider "circonus" {
  alias = "b8fec159-f9e5-4fe6-ad2c-dc1ec6751586"
}

resource "circonus_metric" "usage" {
  name = "_usage`0`_used"
  type = "numeric"
  unit = "qty"
  tags = { source = "circonus" }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_metric resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_metric.usage ID
Where ID is a random, never before used UUID and circonus_metric.usage is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A long-form description of the metric cluster.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the metric cluster. This name must be unique across all metric clusters in a given Circonus Account.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Required) One or more query attributes must be present. Each query must contain both a definition and a type. See below for details on supported attributes.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags attached to the metric cluster.

properties.name: supported-metric-cluster-query-attributes
properties.description: » Supported Metric Cluster query Attributes

properties.name: definition
properties.description: • definition - (Required) The definition of a metric cluster query.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The query type to execute per metric cluster. Valid query types are: average, count, counter, counter2, counter2_stddev, counter_stddev, derive, derive2, derive2_stddev, derive_stddev, histogram, stddev, text.

properties.name: out-parameters
properties.description: » Out parameters

properties.name: id
properties.description: ID of the Metric Cluster.

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_metric_cluster supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform:

provider "circonus" {
  alias = "b8fec159-f9e5-4fe6-ad2c-dc1ec6751586"
}

resource "circonus_metric_cluster" "mymetriccluster" {
  name = "Metric Cluster for a particular metric in a job"

  query {
    definition = "*`nomad-jobname`memory`rss"
    type       = "average"
  }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_metric_cluster resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_metric_cluster.mymetriccluster ID

Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the Metric Cluster (e.g. /metric_cluster/12345) and circonus_metric_cluster.mymetriccluster is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: check
properties.description: • check - (Required) The Circonus ID that this Rule Set will use to search for a metric stream to alert on.

properties.name: if
properties.description: • if - (Required) One or more ordered predicate clauses that describe when Circonus should generate a notification. See below for details on the structure of an if configuration clause.

properties.name: link
properties.description: • link - (Optional) A link to external documentation (or anything else you feel is important) when a notification is sent. This value will show up in email alerts and the Circonus UI.

properties.name: metric_type
properties.description: • metric_type - (Optional) The type of metric this rule set will operate on. Valid values are numeric (the default) and text.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Notes about this rule set.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: • parent - (Optional) A Circonus Metric ID that, if specified and active with a severity 1 alert, will silence this rule set until all of the severity 1 alerts on the parent clear. This value must match the format ${check_id}_${metric_name}.

properties.name: metric_name
properties.description: • metric_name - (Required) The name of the metric stream within a given check that this rule set is active on.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags assigned to this rule set.

properties.name: if-configuration
properties.description: » if Configuration

The if configuration block is an ordered list of rules that are evaluated in order, first to last. The first if condition to evaluate true shortcircuits all other if blocks in this rule set. An if block is also referred to as a "rule." It is advised that all high-severity rules are ordered before low-severity rules otherwise low-severity rules will mask notifications that should be delivered with a high-severity.

if blocks are made up of two configuration blocks: value and then. The value configuration block specifies the criteria underwhich the metric streams are evaluated. The then configuration block, optional, specifies what action to take.

properties.name: value-configuration
properties.description: » value Configuration

A value block can have only one of several "predicate" attributes specified because they conflict with each other. The list of mutually exclusive predicates is dependent on the metric_type. To evaluate multiple predicates, create multiple if configuration blocks in the proper order.

properties.name: numeric-predicates
properties.description: » numeric Predicates
Metric types of type numeric support the following predicates. Only one of the following predicates may be specified at a time.

properties.name: absent
properties.description: • absent - (Optional) If a metric has not been observed in this duration the rule will fire. When present, this duration is evaluated in terms of seconds.

properties.name: changed
properties.description: • changed - (Optional) A boolean indicating this rule should fire when the value changes (e.g. n != n<sub>1</sub>).

properties.name: min_value
properties.description: • min_value - (Optional) When the value is less than this value, this rule will fire (e.g. n < ${min_value}).

properties.name: max_value
properties.description: • max_value - (Optional) When the value is greater than this value, this rule will fire (e.g. n > ${max_value}).

Additionally, a numeric check can also evaluate data based on a windowing function versus the last measured value in the metric stream. In order to have a rule evaluate on derived value from a window, include a nested over attribute inside of the value configuration block. An over attribute needs two attributes:

properties.name: last
properties.description: • last - (Optional) A duration for the sliding window. Default 300s.

properties.name: using
properties.description: • using - (Optional) The window function to use over the last interval. Valid window functions include: average (the default), stddev, derive, derive_stddev, counter, counter_stddev, derive_2, derive_2_stddev, counter_2, and counter_2_stddev.

properties.name: text-predicates
properties.description: » text Predicates
Metric types of type text support the following predicates:

properties.name: absent
properties.description: • absent - (Optional) If a metric has not been observed in this duration the rule will fire. When present, this duration is evaluated in terms of seconds.

properties.name: changed
properties.description: • changed - (Optional) A boolean indicating this rule should fire when the last value in the metric stream changed from it's previous value (e.g. n != n-1).

properties.name: contains
properties.description: • contains - (Optional) When the last value in the metric stream the value is less than this value, this rule will fire (e.g. strstr(n, ${contains}) != NULL).

properties.name: match
properties.description: • match - (Optional) When the last value in the metric stream value exactly matches this configured value, this rule will fire (e.g. strcmp(n, ${match}) == 0).

properties.name: not_contain
properties.description: • not_contain - (Optional) When the last value in the metric stream does not match this configured value, this rule will fire (e.g. strstr(n, ${contains}) == NULL).

properties.name: not_match
properties.description: • not_match - (Optional) When the last value in the metric stream does not match this configured value, this rule will fire (e.g. strstr(n, ${not_match}) == NULL).

properties.name: then-configuration
properties.description: » then Configuration
A then block can have the following attributes:

properties.name: after
properties.description: (Optional) Only execute this notification after waiting for this number of minutes. Defaults to immediately, or 0m.

properties.name: notify
properties.description: (Optional) A list of contact group IDs to notify when this rule is sends off a notification.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: (Optional) The severity level of the notification. This can be set to any value between 0 and 5. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
circonus_rule_set supports importing resources. Supposing the following Terraform (and that the referenced circonus_metric and circonus_check have already been imported):

resource "circonus_rule_set" "icmp-latency-alert" {
  check = "${circonus_check.api_latency.checks[0]}"
  metric_name = "maximum"

  if {
    value {
      absent = "600s"
    }

    then {
      notify = [ "${circonus_contact_group.test-trigger.id}" ]
      severity = 1
    }
  }

  if {
    value {
      over {
        last = "120s"
        using = "average"
      }

      max_value = 0.5 # units are in miliseconds
    }

    then {
      notify = [ "${circonus_contact_group.test-trigger.id}" ]
      severity = 2
    }
  }
}
It is possible to import a circonus_rule_set resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_rule_set.icmp-latency-alert ID

Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the Rule Set (e.g. /rule_set/201285_maximum) and circonus_rule_set.icmp-latency-alert is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.

properties.name: title
properties.description: • title - (Required) The title of the worksheet.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of what the worksheet is for.

properties.name: favourite
properties.description: • favourite - (Optional) Mark (star) this worksheet as a favorite. Default is false.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) A place to store notes about this worksheet.

properties.name: graphs
properties.description: • graphs - (Optional) A list of graphs that compose this worksheet.

properties.name: smart_queries
properties.description: • smart_queries - (Optional) The smart queries that will be displayed on this worksheet. See below for details on how to configure a smart_query.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags assigned to this worksheet.

properties.name: smart_queries-attributes
properties.description: » smart_queries Attributes
smart_queries is a list of smart query objects. Each smart query object has the following required attributes:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name (heading) for the smart graph section in the worksheet.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Required) A search query that determines which graphs will be shown..

properties.name: import-example
properties.description: » Import Example
It is possible to import a circonus_worksheet resource with the following command:
$ terraform import circonus_worksheet.icmp-latency ID

Where ID is the _cid or Circonus ID of the worksheet (e.g. worksheets/45640239-bb81-4ecb-81e6-b5c6015e5dd5) and circonus_worksheet.icmp-latency is the name of the resource whose state will be populated as a result of the command.
